content.description: Start on the lowest of the good crimps and proceed up and slightly to the right to decent holds in the crack for the top out. Arete is off.
content.location: South bank, roughly 150 feet south of the trail entrance from the parking lot. The western of the two boulders between the tall roof boulder and the creek.

content.description: Start on the low crimps, move up and slightly right to top out. This is the same as Short But Sweet, but the arete is ON.Robin's guide has this listed as a V0, but it felt significantly harder than the other V0s at NWB
content.location: On the boulder under the big roof, between the roof and the stream. It is on the upstream end of the roof boulder.

content.description: Traverse right a few feet past Do It Or... Better Do It, then go up and out to pull the roof at a jug, using your guns to stay safe. If Do It is a terrifying V1 for V5 climbers, this is more of a V0 for V1 climbers.
content.protection: The traverse is safe. The topout is juggy but not protectable. Taller climbers may be able to step off instead of committing to the topout.
content.location: Starts at the arête at the left end of the roof, same as Denim Devil.

content.description: Sit at the start of The Denim Devil and do the first move to the jug, then turn the corner and stay low. Traverse the entire length of the boulder under the roof while avoiding dabbing.  After turning the far corner, step off at the crack.
content.location: Same start as Denim Devil and traverses most of the boulder.

content.description: Start on the far left side and traverse the lip rightward. Once you reach the jug, finish straight up.
content.protection: 2 pads, plus a good driftwood platform
content.location: Just right of The Business, on the backside (facing the river) of the boulders beneath the roof.

content.description: Start on the far left side and traverse the lip rightward. Once you reach the jug, continue right to the face and finish up through the top of Short But Sweet.
content.protection: 3 pads for the full length, plus a good driftwood platform
content.location: Just right of The Business, on the backside (facing the river) of the boulders beneath the roof.

content.description: Start on the left side of the large protruding "feature" at the base of the boulder. Find your way up to the lip then pull up and over.
content.location: About 100 ft upstream of the Roof Boulder, towards the road.

content.description: To the right of "The Feature" there are some nice slots in a crack. Sit start in the nice slots, avoid dabbing, and move up to a large triangle-shaped feature above you. The rocks/pedestals below you are off (including the one you are sitting on to start), only use feet on the boulder itself, nothing detached.
content.location: Walk about 100 feet upstream from the roof boulder. This climb is to the right of "The Feature"

content.description: Start on the far right side of the boulder with hands on the arete. Traverse left on the lip past "The Even Bigger Feature" and top out over "The Feature".
content.location: About 100 ft upstream of the Roof Boulder, towards the road.

climbs.name: Do It Or... Better Do It

content.description: Slab to cracks in roof to dish on the lip mantle top out. Heady moderate. Area classic.
Start on the arete at the downstream end of the roof. Climb up the corner and crack and top out.
content.protection: Needs a pad and a spotter, but the landing has been improved so at least the pad will stay put.

content.description: Sit start on the bottom right jugs, go up right to a huge sidepull then climb the face on crimps. Crack off. (Taken from Dan Michels video)
content.location: Starts on the bottom right jugs

content.description: Sit start to Crimptastic. Start on crimps below and to the right of the Crimptastic stand start. Climb into and finish on Crimptastic.I've seen this graded as V6 elsewhere online, and also that some say it's a soft V6. Leave your grade opinion here on this page and MP's algorithm will do it's thing.
content.protection: At least 2 pads to protect the awkwardly-placed rock right in the middle of the landing. Landing is also sloped.

content.description:
climb the face. slightly overhung and sharp.

 Edit: upgraded to V4
content.location: as soon as you start on trail, look across the stream, and slightly to the right for an obvious roof.

content.description: Sit start on tough crimp in middle of face and move up and right on crimps to top, without using crack or arete below crack.
content.location: Starts matched on that thin crimp

content.description: Start on the large undercling rail way down under and use the obvious slopers and crimps and protrusions to go straight up and top out at the tallest point. I do not recommend falling left. I do recommend double checking the structural integrity of the landing platform before climbing.
content.protection: 1-2 pads if you're not worried about going over the edge of the platform, many pads and multiple spotters if you are.
content.location: 150 feet south of the Burnt Mills parking lot. On the upstream face of the larger of the two boulders right there next to/under The Roof boulder. Look for the driftwood landing platform.

content.description: Area around 20 foot long boulder with a 3-foot roof, close to creek.
